name: German Shepherd
description: The German Shepherd is one of the world's most versatile and intelligent dog breeds—loyal, confident, and highly trainable. Known for their courage, devotion, and protective nature, German Shepherds excel in working roles, family environments, and as service dogs.

adaptability.description: German Shepherds adapt well to both hot and cold climates, thanks to their double coat.

diet.title: DIET
diet.mainDescription: German Shepherds thrive on a high-protein, balanced diet rich in animal-based proteins, healthy fats, and essential vitamins to support their active lifestyle and joint health.

tips.title: Choose a protein-rich diet
tips.description: German Shepherds have a high energy level and require a high protein diet to support their active lifestyle. Look for a diet with at least 18-25% protein for adult German Shepherds and even more for growing puppies.

tips.title: Avoid fillers & additives
tips.description: German Shepherds have a sensitive stomach and should avoid food that includes fillers such as wheat and soy that are difficult to digest and may cause allergies.

tips.title: Add Essential Fatty Acids
tips.description: German Shepherds have a thick double coat that requires a diet which includes essential fatty acids to keep them healthy and shiny. Look for food that contains Omega-3 and Omega-6 fatty acids.

tips.title: Consider their age
tips.description: Choose an appropriate diet according to your German Shepherd's age, as puppies need more protein and fat for growth, while adult and senior dogs may require lower levels for weight maintenance.

training.title: GERMAN SHEPHERD TRAINING
training.mainDescription: German Shepherds require regular exercise, proper grooming, socialization, and consistent training to maintain their physical health and mental well-being.

tips.title: Physical training and exercises
tips.description: German Shepherds require regular physical exercise. Include activities such as running, playing fetch, swimming, agility training, or hiking in their training regime.

tips.title: Interactive play
tips.description: German Shepherds require mental stimulation to keep their minds active. Activities such as scent-retention games and puzzle toys are great options to keep them stimulated.

grooming.title: GROOMING
grooming.subtitle: German Shepherds have relatively low grooming needs despite having dense and medium-length coats. Here are some essential tips to ensure they shine.
grooming.mainDescription: German Shepherds have relatively low grooming needs despite having dense and medium-length coats. Here are some essential tips to ensure they shine.

tips.title: Brush and bath
tips.description: German Shepherds should be regularly brushed to remove loose hair and distribute natural oils. Occasional bathing is sufficient to keep them clean and fresh.

tips.title: Keep their ears clean
tips.description: German Shepherds have ears prone to infections, so it's important to check their ears regularly and to clean them when required with a cotton ball and a mild ear-cleaning solution.
